title: Update useActor hook to prepare telemetry actor state

requirements.text: In frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, update the React import statement to include useState: import { useEffect, useState } from 'react';

quotes: Update the React import at the top to include useState: import { useEffect, useState } from 'react';

acceptanceCriteria: The import statement at the top of useActor.ts includes both useEffect and useState

requirements.text: In frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, inside the useActor function right below the queryClient declaration, add a new state variable: const [telemetryActor, setTelemetryActor] = useState<any>(null);

quotes: Inside the useActor function, right below the queryClient declaration, add a new state variable: const [telemetryActor, setTelemetryActor] = useState<any>(null);

acceptanceCriteria: The telemetryActor state variable is declared immediately after the queryClient declaration
The state is initialized to null with type annotation <any>

requirements.text: In frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, update the return statement at the very bottom to return three properties: return { actor: actorQuery.data || null, telemetryActor, isFetching: actorQuery.isFetching };

quotes: At the very bottom, update the return statement to output three things exactly like this: return { actor: actorQuery.data || null, telemetryActor, isFetching: actorQuery.isFetching };

acceptanceCriteria: The return statement includes all three properties: actor, telemetryActor, and isFetching
The actor property uses the existing actorQuery.data with null fallback
The telemetryActor property is included in the return object

constraints: Do not modify backend/main.mo under any circumstances
Do not modify the existing actorQuery in useActor.ts
Do not modify the existing useEffect in useActor.ts
nonGoals: Connecting telemetry actor to any backend canister
Adding additional functionality beyond the three specified changes
